sanskrit_verse:
नोत्पादयेत्स्वयं कार्यं राजा नाप्यस्य पूरुषः ।
न च प्रापितमन्येन ग्रसेदर्थं कथं चन ॥ ८.४३॥
transliteration:
na utpādayet svayaṁ kāryaṁ rājā na āpyasya pūruṣaḥ |
na ca prāpitam anyena grased arthaṁ kathaṁ cana || 8.43||
sph_interpretive_translation: The King does not initiate action independently; nor does any individual acting under him consume or seize wealth acquired by another through rightful means.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from Dharma, not personal will
Causation is anchored in alignment with cosmic order
Capacity-based responsibility requires non-interference in others' lawful gains
Restoration logic demands preservation of integrity in acquired wealth
Consciousness alignment necessitates respect for the sequential manifestation of another's effort
executable_legal_axioms: IF a ruler initiates unauthorized action THEN execution is suspended until alignment with Dharma is verified
IF an agent consumes resources obtained by another through legitimate means THEN access to administrative functions is revoked pending completion process
IF wealth transfer occurs without consent and lawful cause THEN automatic reversal protocol activates and integrity audit commences
IF causal chain of acquisition is traced back to rightful actor THEN possession remains undisturbed regardless of hierarchical position
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this principle establishes that no executive authority may unilaterally create obligations or interfere with legitimately acquired assets. The threshold of responsibility lies in recognizing pre-existing rightful claims. Hierarchical power does not override pramāṇa-based ownership.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that rightful acquisition precedes interference. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures that prior entitlement must be honored before subsequent claims. Proportional responsibility rests on refraining from unwarranted intervention. The non-punitive reality rule upholds that misalignment leads to cessation of function, not imposition of suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process for unauthorized actions through supervised reversal
Assign responsibility assumption protocol to offending party to restore affected asset flow
Enforce capacity restoration via mandatory Dharma alignment training before reactivation of executive roles
Implement integrity reintegration through public acknowledgment and systemic correction of deviation
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Dharma prevails through conscious alignment, not punitive force. Authority serves restoration. Consciousness remains the ultimate adjudicator.
